items.summary: Aviva Siegel, who was released in November 2023, told the UN anti-torture committee that the Hamas captors sexually abused the girls she was held with. Keith Siegel said he was 'denied the most basic of human rights. More than once, young terrorists forced me to strip in front of them and shaved my

items.title: Jack Schlossberg, grandson of JFK, to run for U.S. Congress
items.summary: Political commentator and writer Schlossberg, whose work has appeared in The Washington Post, Politico, and Time, joins a crowded field vying for the 12th Congressional District seat as Democrats aim to regain the House in the 2026 midterms

items.title: Palestinian teenager dies in West Bank after month-long coma from IDF tear gas inhalation
items.summary: 13-year-old Issam Jihad Ma'ala began convulsing and suffocating when the IDF started dispersing olive pickers with gas grenades, despite eyewitnesses saying the pickers posed no danger to the soldiers. 'They simply threw gas in every direction,' one eyewitness said

items.title: Trump is showering Netanyahu with gifts. What is he getting in return?
items.summary: Trump's intervention in Netanyahu's trial, breaking all bounds of U.S. involvement in Israeli politics, is a cause for celebration for the prime minister, proving Trump is doing all he can to shield him from the consequences of his own actions

items.title: Ex-Israel Police officer with PTSD dies after self-immolating outside Defense Ministry official's home
items.summary: The officer, 46-year-old Vital Mishayev, had long been recognized within the Defense Ministry's rehabilitation department as struggling with both physical and mental health issues, including post-traumatic stress

items.title: Senior Israel Police officer investigated for breach of trust, abuse of authority
items.summary: According to police sources familiar with the case, the officer, who holds a key and sensitive position overseeing national police units, is suspected of intervening in an investigation and making decisions to benefit a person close to him

items.title: Knesset advances bill granting tax breaks to Israeli West Bank settlements in 'threatened' areas
items.summary: Israeli settlements classified as 'under threat' would receive a 25 percent addition in the total scoring for tax benefits. The bill 'joins the revolution in Judea and Samaria, which effectively consolidates Israeli sovereignty,' settler councils said

items.title: It's not a 'hasbara failure' to seek justice for Palestinian detainees sexually abused by IDF soldiers
items.summary: Rape is not about sexuality, but about power, whether committed by Hamas on October 7 or by Israeli soldiers at the Sde Teiman detention center. In Israel, the furore over a leaked video of sexual torture, and its politicization by Netanyahu, is overshadowing what's really at stake

items.title: Zikim crossing, north of Gaza Strip, opens to allow aid for first time since cease-fire
items.summary: Opening the northern checkpoint will enable larger quantities of aid to enter the Strip. However, the UN claims that Israel still heavily restricts the entry of aid. On Tuesday, UNICEF said it was denied by Israel from bringing syringes needed for a children's vaccination efforts

items.title: House Democrats release Epstein papers saying Trump 'knew about the girls'
items.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump has vehemently and consistently denied knowing about Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking. He has said that he and Epstein, who died by suicide in a Manhattan jail cell in 2019, were once friends before having a falling out

items.title: Netanyahu MK says Kahane 'was right about many things,' Likud was wrong to shun him
items.summary: At the Knesset, Deputy Speaker Nissim Vaturi praised Rabbi Meir Kahane, who called for expelling Arabs and was later designated a terrorist by Israel and the U.S. When Kahane served in the Knesset, lawmakers across the spectrum, including Likud members, often left the chamber in protest

items.title: Nobody wants this? Netanyahu is gaslighting Israelis over October 7 investigation
items.summary: The prime minister is trying to convince the Israeli public that they don't want an independent state commission of inquiry to investigate the events of October 7, when all polls show that they do. Can it work?

items.title: Violent settlers are 'fringe teens' but attacks on Palestinians can destabilize West Bank, IDF source warns
items.summary: The IDF chief said the settler attacks are distracting Israeli soldiers from 'protecting settlements and carrying out offensive operations,' amid the sharpest rise in almost two decades in incidents of settler violence. While the IDF is trying to cope with the violence, it largely places responsibil

items.title: Israel and Albania strengthen ties as Elbit to provide it with artillery, mortars and drones
items.summary: An official document states that the Israeli defense company will help Albania, a member of NATO, establish an independent defense industry. Meanwhile, Haaretz has learned that despite Brazil's pro-Palestinian stance, it extended a multimillion-dollar contract with Elbit Systems

items.title: West Bank barrier and Palestinian homes may be relocated to make room for incineration plant
items.summary: Two buildings and 37 acres of Palestinian agricultural land are designated to be expropriated for a planned waste incineration plant expected to reduce the amount of garbage sent to landfills in Israel. 'I worked all my life to build this house,' a resident facing eviction told Haaretz

items.title: Under the radar, quiet and persistent population transfer is underway in the West Bank
items.summary: While Israeli settlers drive Palestinians from their land through violence, another, quieter expulsion continues through bureaucracy and law

items.title: Ron Dermer, Netanyahu confidant and Trump administration pointman, resigns from Israeli government
items.summary: In a letter to Netanyahu, Dermer cited family commitments for his resignation, writing, 'This government will be remembered for the October 7 attack and its handling of the war.' His departure is another sign of the unraveling inner circle around the prime minister as the war ends

items.title: 'Extra brain power': Hebrew Israelite rabbinical body votes to ordain women after more than a decade of debate
items.summary: After the vote, Rabbis Malchah Netanyahu and Tamar Manasseh were swiftly welcomed to the movement's board of rabbis in the United States. 'It's a historic decision. I wish it could be celebrated among the wider Jewish community,' says Netanyahu

items.title: Dozens of Israeli settlers set property on fire, attack IDF soldiers in West Bank; only one arrested for arson
items.summary: The IDF said after the attacks that it opposes 'all forms of violence that divert commanders' and soldiers' attention,' adding that two suspects who were detained managed to escape

items.title: 'We may have reached the point where settlers try to kill Jews'
items.summary: Oded Yedaya was hit by a large stone thrown by a settler in the West Bank. The artist and political activist – who once served alongside Benjamin Netanyahu in an elite military unit – explains what that could mean for solidarity activism

items.title: Archaeologists crack century-old mystery: What were clay cornets used for 6,000 years ago?
items.summary: Ceramic 'ice cream cones' were oddly diverse and don't evince much skill, but had to have been of profound importance in Chalcolithic Israel

items.title: Israelis see U.S. as more influential over Israel's security decisions than own government, poll shows
items.summary: The survey also found that a plurality of Jewish Israelis support West Bank annexation, while a majority of Arab respondents believe a diplomatic solution is needed. Researchers also noted a 10 percent drop in opposition to the judicial overhaul

items.title: Israeli West Bank settlers raid Palestinians' olive grove with IDF escort; one defiles grave
items.summary: A Palestinian who called the Israel Police to report the settlers was detained by the IDF and released later that evening. The soldiers' escort of settlers and their livestock in the grove violates military guidelines requiring troops to protect Palestinians and their property

items.title: 'Zionism is racism'? When Haaretz defended Zionism – and denounced the UN
items.summary: Fifty years ago, the UN adopted the controversial resolution. Israel, the U.S. and Haaretz condemned it. UN Ambassador Chaim Herzog tore up a copy on the UN floor. Only Haaretz columnist Yoel Marcus remained unfazed

items.title: U.S. submits new draft proposal to UN Security Council on international Gaza stabilization force
items.summary: Main changes from the previous draft include recognition of the Saudi-French initiative on Palestine, mention of an Israeli withdrawal to the security perimeter in Gaza, and a demand to report the International Stabilization Force's operations to the UN

items.title: Report: IDF destroyed over 1,500 buildings in IDF-controlled parts of Gaza since cease-fire took effect
items.summary: An analysis by BBC Verify shows neighborhoods behind the Yellow Line have been destroyed by IDF forces, in an act some say may constitute a violation of the Trump-led cease-fire between Israel and Hamas

items.title: Russia's AI robot falls seconds after being unveiled
items.summary: Footage shows the moment Russia's first anthropomorphic robot fell just seconds after its debut

items.title: Trump formally asks Israel's president to 'fully pardon' Netanyahu in corruption case
items.summary: Calling Netanyahu's trial 'a political, unjustified prosecution,' Trump asked Israel's President Herzog in a formal letter to pardon Netanyahu, who faces charges of bribery, fraud, and breach of trust in three separate criminal cases; Netanyahu responded to Trump: 'You get right to the point and cal

items.title: One step closer to a constitutional crisis, just as intended by Israel's justice minister
items.summary: A three-judge panel overseeing the IDF abuse video probe called for a reasoned compromise amid a session marked by chaos and madness, pushing the High Court to the brink of surrendering to street-level culture

items.title: Australian windsurfer escapes shark attack
items.summary: Andy McDonald recalls moment he encountered a shark while windsurfing in Western Australia this week.

items.title: 'Harms the war effort': Israel's defense minister announces proposal to shutter army radio
items.summary: According to Defense Minister Israel Katz, Army Radio was established 'to serve as a voice and an ear for IDF soldiers and their families, and not as a platform for voicing opinions, many of which attack the IDF and its soldiers'

items.title: Netanyahu thanks Trump for request to pardon him: 'As usual, you call it like it is'
Israel's GPO issues calendar with pictures of hostages, omits foreigners' names
items.summary: Five captives released last January are identified in English as 'Thai hostage,' while the Israeli hostages are all named. The press office blames 'tight timetable' for omission, but names were easily available from announcements made at the time by the Prime Minister's Office and Thai Embassy in Is

items.title: Israel's growing appetite for censorship: Al Jazeera Law passes first reading
This Israeli civics teacher taught us all a lesson in standing up to suppression
Israel's top court abandoned the attorney general once again, exposing its own moral collapse
items.summary: The justices should have backed Gali Baharav-Miara in the fight to preserve the rule of law, but it seems that Netanyahu and his allies have also succeeded in intimidating the court. Their call for a compromise is another slap in the attorney general's face

items.title: Israel and its evil government cannot give up on the war
Israel's opposition leaders cannot pre-exlcude Arab citizens from government
Haaretz Cartoon
Israel's top court sets 48-hour deadline for deal over who will run investigation into ex-IDF lawyer
items.summary: Justice Ministry and attorney general remain at loggerheads over who has authority to investigate leak of video showing Palestinian detainee being abused at the Sde Teiman detention facility and the subsequent cover-up ■ Justices have given the sides until noon on Thursday to agree – or it will make

items.title: At Hadar Goldin's funeral, hearts sought closure, but his family never forgot the neglect
items.summary: The Goldins' struggle ended exactly where it began – at the military cemetery in Kfar Sava. 11 years and three months after holding his first funeral, the masses made sure to see him off one final time. 'There was no fear of sin here all this time,' says his older brother. 'They were busy with every

items.title: Residents of northern Israel bemoan illegal burning of garbage: 'We're helpless'
items.summary: Over 2,000 complaints were received about air pollution and bad odors over the past year and a half in the Jezreel Valley region. The fires are from Arab towns who don't have the budget to treat their waste – and criminals have taken over the garbage collection

items.title: What is Gaza's Yellow Line – and why does it signal trouble ahead?
items.summary: Israel controls 53 percent of Gaza along a boundary meant to be temporary. Reconstruction is moving forward – but only on the Israeli-controlled side of the line

items.title: Ex-comedian John Cleese cancels Israel shows while amplifying social media posts by antisemitic conspiracy theorists
items.summary: The Monty Python and Fawlty Towers star, 86, said he will reschedule the shows 'as soon as possible' but the cancellation follows a flurry of anti-Israel and conspiratorial posts recirculating far-right influencers and viral misinformation accounts

items.title: IDF to hold hearing for officer who planned trip to Lebanese fortress that left soldier, scholar dead
items.summary: 'We won't let this go,' says Gur Kehati's grandfather, as the army prepares a long-delayed hearing for Col. (res.) Yoav Yarom, who launched a scouting operation in Lebanon that led to the soldier's death. A year on, no indictment, no operational report, no conclusions and no accountability for the l

items.title: Int'l conservation union calls on Israel to reverse plans that could threaten endangered rodent
items.summary: The Buxton's jird is endemic to Israel and Sinai, and lives along coastal dunes. Its fate largely depends on a hearing of objections to the construction plan in Rishon Letzion, which took place on Sunday

items.title: IDF could have been better prepared for Hamas attack if Netanyahu had acted differently, report states
items.summary: State Comptroller Matanyahu Englman warned that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's failure to formalize Israel's national security concept left the IDF and defense establishment directionless, with decades of governmental inaction compounding the risks – so on October 7, Israel faced Hamas

items.title: Flares at a concert hall aren't criticism, they're intimidation. The Israel Philharmonic isn't cowed
items.summary: A clear line separates political debate and the harming of cultural freedom, even when it's protesters demonstrating against the war in Gaza

items.title: Settlers raid West Bank industrial zone, wound four Palestinians, attack IDF soldiers
items.summary: Videos of the raid in the Beit Lid industrial zone show settlers setting cars, fields and several buildings ablaze. The IDF said the masked settlers then fled to the area of the Kedumim Industrial Zone, where they attacked Israeli soldiers and damaged an army vehicle

items.title: 'There's a limit': Hezbollah chief says Israeli strikes show why group must not disarm
items.summary: Hezbollah Secretary-General Naim Qassem made the comments against the backdrop of Israel's preparations for several days of fighting in Lebanon, following warnings from senior IDF officials about Hezbollah's increasing attempts to restore its power

items.title: Turkish prosecutor demands top court shutter Erdoğan's main opposition party
items.summary: The prosecutor also pressed the court to sentence Erdoğan's rival, Istanbul's Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, the jailed leader of the Republican People's Party, to over 2,000 years in prison, for allegedly leading a vast corruption network that cost the state billions of lira

items.title: Geolocating Darfur Killings of Those Escaping Al Fashir
items.summary: Warning: Contains written descriptions of extreme violence including murder. All graphic footage has been omitted. A Bellingcat investigation has identified and verified the exact location of a mass killing of more than 80 people that took place near Al Fashir during the recent siege and takeover of

items.summary: An investigation by Bellingcat has identified yet another Russian-flagged bulk carrier, Irtysh (IMO: 9664976), operating in defiance of Western sanctions by exporting grain from occupied Crimea to Houthi-controlled Yemen.  Following the same pattern of deceptive methods used by other vessels in

items.title: Wildfires Ravage One of Africa’s Largest Nature Reserves
items.summary: Late last month, fires engulfed Namibia’s most visited wildlife reserve – Etosha National Park. An analysis of satellite imagery by Bellingcat has found that more than a third of the park was affected, impacting crucial grazing lands for endangered species, including black rhinos, giraffes and

items.summary: This article is the result of a collaboration with The Sunday Times. To stay up to date on our latest investigations, join Bellingcat’s new WhatsApp channel here. An Australian pilot who recently died when his small plane crashed in South America during a failed drug run has links to an alleged Kina

items.summary: To stay up to date on our latest investigations, join Bellingcat’s new WhatsApp channel here. items.title: Incendiary Munitions Strike Gaza-bound Flotilla Two Nights in a Row
items.summary: On September 8 and 9, two vessels of the Gaza-bound Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF) were attacked outside the port of Sidi Bou Said in Tunisia. Bellingcat analysed footage and images from both incidents. The experts consulted believe improvised incendiary munitions were likely used. The trajectory follo

items.summary: Four masked men in police tactical vests surround a young scooter rider, cuffing his hands behind his back.
